Name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Marvel 101
Description:
In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios.
Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens.

Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system—the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again—so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game Expansion: Thanos is an expansion for any standalone title in the Funkoverse line-up.

Funkoverse Strategy Game Expansion: Marvel 101 Thanos Expansion is an expansion for any standalone title in the Funkoverse line-up.

Name: Introduction to (Drawing) Graph Theory
Description:
In this game, we will draw simple graphs using resources available to us: vertices, edges, and Eulerian (this resource acts as currency). To draw a graph, we need vertices and edges. We use Eulerian to use the effect of an active Extra Power card.

Each round we will choose one resource card from the ones available in that round, one resource card usually contains a number of two different resources. There is also Extra Power that we can use for that round. This Extra Power changes every round.

Name: Lollipops
Description:
Keep an eye out for the quantity, color, and type of candy. As soon as you see a common feature on 3 cards put them in your victory pile! Very fast, very simple, very fun. 
There are 5 colours, 4 types of sweets and 3 options of quantity on the cards. 
Cards are being laid out slowly. 
All players watch the opened cards and act simultaneously.
As soon as there are 3 cards with a common feature on the table players have to identify the feature and say it out loud. E.g. "Ice cream!" or "Blue!" or "Two!" 
Whoever calls out the feature first takes the cards.
The goal is to collect the most cards.
Where are some wild cards which can block a category or substitute any feature in category.

5 cool things about Lollipops

     everyone loves sweets
     fast-paced and noisy gameplay – perfect icebreaker
     keeping in mind 3 features instantly pumps up the reaction, speed, and attentiveness
     just a little space needed to play
     easy to carry around.


—description from the publisher

Name: Jagd auf den Feuerfisch
Description:
Divers go on an underwater hunt and must reach the firefish before their opponents in order to win. Whoever wins the respective trick can draw their diver and lay event cards. Each player has a stack of face-down cards and draws the top one. Whoever lays the highest draw card wins the trick and the cards. Then he draws the value of the collected move cards, won event cards he may place beforehand for his own advantage or disadvantage of the opponents. The full number must be drawn, several pieces may stand on one square, the target square must be reached directly, excess points must be drawn backwards.

—user summary

Name: ナンバースイッチ (Number Switch)
Description:
ãƒŠãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒƒãƒ (Number Switch) is a game from Japan, based upon a local news story. An electronics store was giving away a free Nintendo Switch, but didn't use a sensible method of picking the winning number. As a result, two customers had the numbers either side of the winning number. The game designer used this event as the inspiration for this deduction game.

The game uses a suit of 1-13 cards from a normal deck of playing cards. One player is the retailer, the other players are the customers in the lottery. The retailer shuffles the 13 cards and removes one in secret, which nobody sees.

Then the retailer divides the 12 remaining cards into two piles and sorts them each from low to high numbers, placing them face-down. The players take turns to draw the top card from a pile and after getting three hand cards, a player make declare the hidden card. If they are correct, they win.

If the cards run out and no player has guessed correctly, the retailer can declare a number card that a player has (deducing in reverse). If the player does hold that card in their hand, the retailer wins.

As with other games from Loserdogs, this was produced in a simple ziplock baggie with only a page of rules and 13 playing cards.
user summary

Name: Das Froschwanderspiel
Description:
The frogs (pawns) migrate from their winter quarters to the spawning water, but the pond is in danger of drying up. The players move their frogs, clean the pond and fill it with water again. The player whose turn it is draws event cards and the frogs move. They have to stop at danger spots and try to roll the number and the solution for the danger. If the attempt is unsuccessful, a dry stone enters the pond, but the other players can help, forego their movement and roll the dice to remove the danger. Once at the pond, the players can now remove dry stones, always according to the number of frogs already present. If there are fewer than 15 dry stones in the pond at the end and there is no toxic waste in the pond, the players have won.

—user summary

Name: The Final Light-Year: The Delta Sector
Description:
May 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, new crew and a new set of enemies, but instead of a new boss, the kit brings a Spaceport postcard that introduces longer form campaign play.

You'll place the spaceport between two sector maps and play two full games, with a little extra trouble in-between. The enemies and boss at the second sector are boosted, but you can use actions in the first sector to weaken them. It's an all new type of balance, looking toward the long game.

This is the first of many spaceports, each twisting the two game campaign in a new way, and even allowing bigger and bigger campaigns as more are released.


Released in the May 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Robodance
Description:
Find a robot with the right combination of shapes or colors. Repeat the move and collect the winning card. 
Do the robot dance!

There are 20 cards with robots. Each has a unique combination of colors, shapes, and a unique movement. Small cards indicate colors and shapes.
To enjoy the game call your children and their friends, put 20 robot cards in a circle, small cards are in the center. Each round you open a small card. All players are looking for a robot with such colors or shapes. The first person to repeat the move receives the small card as a victory point. The goal is to collect the most cards.
5 cool things about ROBODANCE

     active and dynamic game
     combines developing fast response and attention with movement. 
     the moves such as dab, rock, and peace sign are trendy and kids like to repeat them.
     the complexity can be easily adjusted 
     all players are included in the process throughout the game.


—description from the publisher

Name: Skulls of Sedlec: Poets
Description:
Poets is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Poets. Poets want to be next to forlorn Romantics. They score points per adjacent, non-scoring Romantic.  For those that can't seem to pair up the romantics, you might split them up on purpose now to get the most points out of your poets.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

Name: PURI! PURI! 漏ルカー (Poo Poo Leaker)
Description:
This is a freebie game from Toryo Hojo designed as a "ã‚¯ã‚½ã‚²ãƒ¼RTA" (kusoge real time attack), which is a speed run to make a shitty game.

Players race to the finish line by rolling dice and choosing a result to use for movement, placing poop markers in the space they have left. If a poop marker is in the destination space, the player is eliminated. If another player's piece in the space, the active player rolls for movement again.

The game ends when either a single player remains on the board, or if a player crosses the finish line.

This was distributed as part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack and players must provide their own playing pieces.

Name: う～っ「まん防」！ (Mmm..."Manbo!")
Description:
This is a freebie game by Toryo Hojo where players are the head of local Japanese government and try to reduce the number of people affected by the decline of the economy from COVID-19.
Players muct make good use of the “Manbo” policy to slow down the new Coronavirus!

Each player controls regions of Japan that have a matrix of infected population and economic health. On their turn, a player rolls dice and performs an action from the chart:


     COVID excise tax increase
     Healthcare subsidy
     Unemployment stimulus
     Stay-at-home request
     Go eat
     Go travel
     "Manbo!"


With the other die, they must raise the infected population of the matching region.

Because the COVID outbreak occurred in the same year the Tokyo Olympics were scheduled to happen, the torch relay happens contemporaneously with player actions and is used as a timer for the end of the game.

The game was included as a part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

Name: ボッチャのようなもの (Some Kind of Boccia)
Description:
This is a freebie game designed by Toryo Hojo and requires players to provide their own pieces for play. It was included in the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

Two players compete in a tabletop game of bocce. Players from the red side and the blue side compete by throwing the ball into the court. First, a white ball called “jack” is thrown into the court, and then the red and the blue sides both throw a ball toward the jack. The side with the ball farthest from the jack is the side that throws their balls in first. When one team has used up all their balls, the other team throws their remaining balls into the court. When all the balls have been thrown into the court, the side with the ball closest to the jack scores.

The throws are determined via dice rolls, which also determine the initial drop point of the thrown ball, any deflections of the ball if it collides with another, and the final landing space of all balls involved in the throw and resulting collisions. The board is comprised of a matrix of potential die rolls.

And advanced game adds "focus," which is used to give better direction to the throws.

Name: Act One
Description:
'"For sheer fun, it's one hard act to follow . . ."

Act One is the exciting game where players do "almost anything" to try and get their teammates to guess titles of popular movies and TV shows. You'll laugh your head off (until it's your turn) watching your teammates do their best to act or read famous lines from movies and TV shows while they try to beat the clock (actually it's a sand-timer). The sooner teams guess titles correctly, the more points are scored! (But, who cares who wins, when it's this much fun).

No batteries necessary . . . Teammates not included.

Almost two thousand movie and TV moments from the 70's, 80's and 90's. Great party game.

Games Magazine Top Games Selection

Now includes: 25% more cards & the new "Almost Anything Goes" round!'

—description from the back of the box

Name: Spacers
Description:
You are a spacer; a freelance space traveler in a brand new solar system. You have a ship, a handful of spacebucks, and a wealth of opportunities. How will you become famous?

Spacers is a space adventure game where the goal is to become the most famous traveler in the solar system. You are free to earn fame in a variety of different ways, allowing you to live out the space adventure fantasy that you want. Engage in pick-up and deliver tasks, dice-based combat missions, and even choose-you-own-adventure style encounters!


     Trading! Exploring! Smuggling! Pirating!
     Evolving supply and demand system
     Encounters with varied outcomes
     Randomized setup
     Virtually limitless ways to play


—description from the designer

Name: Heroes of Stalingrad: War Stories – Otto Carius
Description:
War Stories is a series of smaller expansions, much like Heroes of Normandie's Gazettes from before, but with a tighter focus on historical events and soldiers.

Where Gazettes where products designed for die-hard fans, War Stories will be more accessible, requiring less of the massive backlog of previously released expansions. War Stories will mostly be playable with just the core box, and the content of a War Stories issue itself, obviously.

Each issue will focus on a War Hero and will include a biography, his exploits, a dedicated scenario and one or two punchboards to integrate it into your game.

The first issue will be for Heroes of Stalingrad, and focuses on Otto Carius, a German Tiger tank commander who destroyed a total of 150 enemy tanks. This issue will also include a section of T34s for the Russian forces as well as the errata of the Frontoviks from the Heroes of Stalingrad game base box.

Featuring new artwork from Nicola Angius.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Daily Zombie Spawn Set
Description:
Contains 31 Daily Zombie Spawn Figures and a rules leaflet.

This is a Kickstarter exclusive extra.

Name: Forts & Forests:  The War for North America
Description:
In Forts & Forests: The War for North America, you command one of the 18th century’s great superpowers in a struggle to control Canada, the American colonies and the vast wealth of the continent beyond.

But the French & Indian War is only part of a greater global conflict, so resources are limited and must be allocated with care. Militia is easily raised but unreliable. Regular forces deliver power and strength under fire, but they are expensive and must be transported across an ocean. Then there are gifts to the Indians, whose speed and fierce ambushes can turn the tide of the war, but only if their pricey allegiance can be maintained.

Forts & Forests begins with the British poised to launch an ambitious four-pronged attack to bring the war to a speedy end. They have greater numbers, naval superiority and secure ports, but much of their army is made up of untested colonial provincial forces. The push inland from the Atlantic coast will be difficult, and the support of the powerful Iroquois is tepid at best.

Though outnumbered, most French troops are battle hardened regulars recently arrived from Europe. They are supported by fearsome hordes of western tribes who have been convinced to take up the hatchet against the English invaders. New France also has a geographic advantage; troops and supplies can be moved quickly along the St. Lawrence and Great Lakes with relative ease. But the connection to France is tenuous, especially if the bastion at Louisbourg were to fall!

Forts & Forests’ unique combat system captures the challenges and uncertainties of the wilderness war. Over 300 historically accurate unit cards capture their differing combat, ambush, break, and speed ratings. No battle is a sure victory regardless of numerical superiority!

It will take strategy, determination, and a bit of luck to conquer a land of Forts & Forests and win the War for North America.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eternam
Description:
This time you won't be the usual unblemished hero, but the great infernal ruler, master of demons and dragons, summoner of divinity, loved and respected by your cult and feared by the greedy governments of the world!

Eternam is a solitaire dice and cards game. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the monster cards you play. You must choose carefully your demons and dragons, because the stronger the monsters, the more souls they will require of you, and souls are the resource you need to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Linkto Terre
Description:
Linkto Terre is a co-operative trivia game in which players team up to find the key amongst the 50 cards that feature unique earth art.

Together, players link all 49 clue cards to the 50 word cards. They then discover whether the remaining, unlinked word card is the key to their victory, validating its code with the answer card to know whether they've won the game!

Linkto Terre offers five levels of difficulty in the game as well as a competitive mode for those who want it.

Name: Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
Description:
"The motto of all the mongoose family is, 'Run and find out'; and Rikki-tikki was a true mongoose."

Based on Rudyard Kipling's short story, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi pits Cobras and Mongooses (or "Mongeese"?) against each other. Rikki-Tikki leads the Mongoose army against Nag and Nagaina and their band of snakes, but be careful when you are scouting through the thick jungle; a harmless snake scout may turn out to be the ruthless Nagaina herself!

Each side seeks to kill the enemy leader using an army of pieces with different abilities. The type of piece is kept secret from your opponent, so you can choose whether to bluff your opponent by keeping your leader brazenly exposed, press your luck with fearless attacks, or strategically cover your pieces with a careful defense.

A modern take on the game of Chess, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi makes each game a thrilling and unique experience that can no longer be "solved", and levels the playing field between enthusiasts and newbies, while still preserving tactical gameplay.

—description from the designer

Name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Solo Play AI Expansion Pack
Description:
The Solo Play AI expansion for The Art of Boxing Clever allows you to pit your wits against three skill levels of AI boxers. Each of the five boxing styles are available to fight against in the form of the 5 boxers from the base game.

Expand your Art of Boxing Clever board game experience with Solo Play. Can you beat a bunch of cards?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Arcade Mode Expansion Pack
Description:
The Arcade mode for The Art of Boxing Clever offers an alternative experience for faster paced gameplay. Perfect for when you are short of time.

Time becomes a factor in your decision making and the original The Art of Boxing Clever damage system is streamlined to create a simplified boxer health bar indicator. All the tactical options are available to you from the original game, but if it's possible this is an even more intense version of the ART of BOXING CLEVER.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monster Clashhh!
Description:
Monster Clashhh! is a fast and fun ROLL & FIGHT game. You have to be first friends with all 5 monsters! When you be a friends with monsters, attack another player! Also you have to keeping the most life points at the same time. Risk management, tactical choices and luck are the keys which will lead you to the victory.

Gameplay

1. Every player receives one summoner’s sheet.
2. Players play clockwise.
3. First player rolls the four dice, trying to get a combo allowing you to fill the spaces of Monster or the spaces of Special Ability. You can roll 3 times the dices (choosing the one(s) you wanna roll again).
4. When you decide to stop (usually after the 3rd roll), trigger the effect of your final combos according to the rules.
5. When you finish, the player at your left can play his turn (by rolling his dice and completing his summoner’s sheet).
6. The game is over when a player succeeds in summoning the five different monsters while having the most HP or if all of his opponents lose all of their HP.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Fighting Dirty Expansion Pack
Description:
The Fighting Dirty expansion for the ART of BOXING CLEVER has been designed to add extra spice to the base game by introducing the underhanded tactics and dark arts of fighting dirty in the boxing ring. The expansion offers players new tactics to gain the upper hand over their opponents and inflict maximum damage on their most vulnerable areas.

Sportsmanship is now a factor. Will your boxer be an instigator or a victim? New options are available for you to decide which approach suits your needs.

Last but by no means least, introducing your referee Mr Geoffrey Weller who be on the lookout for any illegal tactics. Boxer's will be warned, deducted points or even disqualified if spotted.

—description from the designer

Name: Vaction Spin
Description:
Travel to 8 Exotic destinations, with varying prices simulating the variables of real travel. Destinations such as Alaska, Costa Rica, Hawaii, Italy, Mexico, Tahiti.

Object of the game is to travel to as many Destinations within a set time.  There are no dice and spinner offers varying prices.  Player buys vouchers, for example 'Scuba diving in Tahiti 200 X Spin.  If he spins 1, pay $200.  If another player spins 8, pay $1,600 for the Same voucher!

This takes into consideration variables such as traveling High vs. low season, Deluxe vs. economy, Number in your party. This is what makes my game Unique, as there are no set prices in travel.

'Travel Ups and Downs' cards add fun surprises.  Up: Dream vacation, go to any Destination.  Down:  Luggage went on its own vacation, Pay $1,500 to the Travel Bonus corner.  Player who lands on this space gets all the loot!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pick Pic
Description:
Pick Pic is a game about picture associations and crazy funny photos.
You have to divide your photos so they fit the photos in front of each player as well as possible. If the other players recognize your photo as being placed there deliberately, both will score points. But they prefer a random photo to yours, none of you will get any points.

Gameplay

1. Reveal a card : every player draws a card and puts it face up in front of him.
2. Give cards : each player draws a few cards (regarding the number of players) and watches them secretly.
3. Each player has to look carefully at the face up cards of the other players, they must find a common feature between the cards they hold and the one which are in front of the players.
4. Once they finish finding a common feature, they have to give, face down, one card from their hand to every other player.
5. Rank cards : When all players have received exactly one card from each of the other players, they have to draw one random card from the deck and shuffle it into their stack of cards without revealing it.
6. Each player may look at the cards in front of him. They have to rank them face up, placing the card which has most in common with the first picture in first position, and so on.
7. Evaluate score : The players will score points regarding which rank are their cards.
8. End : The game ends when one or few players reach 20 points, if they don’t, they begin another round.

—description from the publisher
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Circustar
Description:
Circustar is a perfect filler game for your game night. Each round, players receives 5 performance cards and players can score once per each performance during the game. So you have to manage your cards and choose which performance to score in each round to earn best score. 
But be careful! Other players may mess up your plan.

—description from the publisher

Name: Goons: The Junkyard Expansion
Description:
The Junkyard Expansion for Goons introduces a brand new Junkyard location to finally give players a chance to do something useful with all those annoying junk cubes laying around! Just snatch a junk cube, take it to the Junkyard and trade it for something useful! Just keep in mind that the Junkyard might want a little something in return...

The expansion also introduces 5 new Items to throw your money at. Get a hold of a super gnarly skateboard, badass nunchucks, a can of refreshing Knuckle Soda, gloves or a butterfly knife!

And of course, 4 more zany Villains with new Schemes presenting new risk, rewards and challenges! Will you throw your support behind Big Carls wacky wildlife shenanigans? Join Aztro’s psychedelic pattern based schemes, support Teresas explosive plans, or help The Void perform his uncanny rites?

—description from the publisher

Name: Anno Domini 1666: Swords of Light and Darkness
Description:
Swords of Light and Darkness is an expansion to Anno Domini 1666, a swashbuckling board game of intrigue and mystery, set in alternative reality 17th century Vienna.

In the Swords of Light and Darkness players will try to convice Elector of Brandenburg Friedrich Wilhelm to vote for candidate supported by their political faction. It depends on you whether Louis XIV of France or Charles II of Spain called El Hechizado  (The Bewitched) will become new emperor. In the shadow of the great politics we'll see duel between the two famous fencers: Salvatore Fabris, possessed by mighty demon Caarcinolaas and Gérard Thibault d'Anvers. Only few people realise that conseqences of duel between Sword of Light and Sword of Darkness could be much more serious than result of the imperial election...

Name: Am Ende des Regenbogens
Description:
In this environmental game, players try to prevent greenland from being covered with mud. In his turn, a player reveals a situation card that shows a positive or negative environmental behaviour. In the case of negative behaviour, the bad figure "Schmutzich" is moved towards a target field, in the case of positive behaviour, the good figure "Knud" may be moved towards the target field. In addition, the player rolls the dice and can move his own figure or "Knud" towards the target field. If "Schmutzich" reaches the target field first, mud is placed on grassland, if "Knud" and a player arrive before "Schmutzich", a rainbow piece is placed. The players win together if they manage to lay 4 rainbow pieces. The players lose if "Schmutzich" was able to lay 4 mud pieces.

—user summary

Name: バトルアスリート (Battle Athlete)
Description:
ãƒãƒˆãƒ«ã‚¢ã‚¹ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒˆ (Battle Athlete) is a racing game from Japan. Players are athletes competing in a road race across mountains and valleys. But the course has obstacles and the players push each other around or use items to get the jump on the others. The first to the finish line is the winner.

The race course is made of large tiles placed in a line. The game has a starting tile, and five course tiles, of which four are used, and a finish line. The course tiles have a variety of icons; walls, pits, arrows and objects.

Players choose the turn order, and the last player puts their athlete where they like on the start line, then the next player and so on. In this way, the start player does not get an advantage.

Players roll dice and move their athlete. If they end up on an icon, or push another athlete onto one, the actions are completed.

Pits make a player fall back 2 places and miss a turn. Walls delay players, and arrows push them in the direction of the arrow. The ? icon lets the player draw an object card from the deck. These objects allow the player to make advances, or delay other players, or even change the position of the course tiles.

The first player to reach the finish line wins the race.

The designer Misaki notes that this was one of their earliest designs. It became the third game published by the doujin circle, but had been a car race game sent to a magazine five years previously. The prototype was made 15 years before 2009, making it 1994. The designer thought it was too good a game to waste and brought it back into production in 2009.
user summary

Name: Biathlon
Description:
The players compete as biathletes. They move their pawns with a dice over a circuit with uphills and downhills. The dice are also rolled at the shooting range.
The player who crosses the finish line first wins the game.
Several rule additions, e.g. event cards, risk minimisation when shooting, increased risk of falling when moving downhill and the use of tactical action cards extend the basic game.

—user summary

Name: Trypsylon
Description:
The game is in the tradition of the abstract connecting games like Hex and consists of 36 identical tiles showing a route in the shape of a "Y". At the beginning, all tiles are arranged face down forming a large square. On your turn, pick a face down tile and push it from the border into the square with the Y face up.
The player who first has a complete route from his side to the opposite side wins.

—user summary

Name: Limbo
Description:
Arithmetic game with a traditional card deck, from David Parlett, creator of Ninety-Nine.  From a hand of 5, players play a card at a time, either deducting from or dividing into the current sum. Totals start at 101 each hand and go down to as close to 0 as possible. The catch is: If card played divides into the sum without remainder then it may not be deducted but must divide. (For instance a 5 played to 20 must divide for 4 rather than deduct for 15, whereas a 3 must deduct since it can't divide into 20 evenly.)

An Ace counts either 1 or 11. A Jack played repeats the same value as the previous card. A Queen reverses the digits of the current count. However, you may only play a Queen if reversing the digits reduces the count. A King divides by any desired number higher than 1 and lower than the current, provided that it leaves no remainder.

The hand ends when one player plays their last card or is unable to play without going below zero.

Name: World War III: Team Yankee – West German
Description:
World War III: Team Yankee – West German offers:

     Background on the West German army,1. Panzerdivision, 3. Panzerdivision,Kampfgruppe Müller, and Panzerlehrbrigade 9;
     Instructions on how to build Leopard 2A5,Leopard 2, & Leopard 1 Panzer, Marder 2,Marder 1, & M113 Panzergrenadier, & three different Panzeraufklärungs companies;
     Three Scenarios to test your skills with your West German force;
     A detailed painting guide to help you prepare your West Germans for combat;


—description from the publisher
Families: Game: World War III – Team Yankee 2 (Battlefront)

Name: World War III: Team Yankee – West German Starter Force: Panzeraufklärungs Kompanie
Description: World War III: Team Yankee – West German Starter Force: Panzeraufklärungs Kompanie, Panzer Reconnaissance Company.
Families: Game: World War III – Team Yankee 2 (Battlefront)

Name: აღმოაჩინე საქართველო (Discover Georgia)
Description:
áƒáƒ¦áƒ›áƒáƒáƒ©áƒ˜áƒœáƒ” áƒ¡áƒáƒ¥áƒáƒ áƒ—áƒ•áƒ”áƒšáƒ , Discover Georgia

Players have to travel to different parts of Georgia and visit different cities

Each turn players draw cards and attempt to claim routes to achieve their objective (cards).
The objective cards indicate destinations between cities in Georgia and bordering countries.
Player scores points by claiming routes (the longer the more points) and achieving their objective (the further away, the more points scored at end of game).

The goal is to visit as many places as possible to earn more points. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Tech Company
Description:
This game puts you behind the wheel of one of the most important tech companies in the last century. You will relive the stories of some of the most influential technology innovators in history that paved the way to what we are capable of today. People like Edwin H. Land, a scientist who invented a whole new paradigm in photography with Polaroid, or Nolan Bushnell who executed on the first ever video gaming ideas with Atari, that drove the world into an age of digital video games and personal computers. It will be like being inside an interactive documentary, where you play the founder first person.

You start as a simple tech start-up and through multiple plays you and the story evolve into giving you the responsibility of turning your first product successes into a real tech company that people worship. A company that aims to take over the world with cutting edge inventions by visionary and quirky personalities.

You will attract the best talent, develop prototypes and turn them into mind boggling customer experiences. You will need to compose a sweet spot of skills in product design and engineering, business, management, marketing, and people. Talent with certain know-how can help you create better quality products. But to make all that happen you need investors and business-savvy individuals who can open the doors you need to succeed in a competitive consumer space of other tech companies - your opponents who you meet over beers at conferences and in courtroom disputes over patent infringement.

Through a new and profound way of pairing a board game with an app on your phone, the initial barrier of getting past a complex set of rules is replaced by a progressive approach that teaches you the game through a simple first start-up story. Then it grows more and more complex over the course of multiple play sessions towards transforming you into becoming a massive tech giant in the end.

The app will also be used to communicate the narrative through audio storytelling, to communicate every mechanic’s tie-in to the theme and context, to manage gaming sessions in this new narrative format, where you can save your progress between play sessions, and to be a rules learning or reminder companion, to get you quickly back into the game, if you have had a break from it.

—description from the designer

Name: Vilket hundkaos
Description: One hundred dogs are on the run and you want to gather as many as possible in your kennel. Why is the dog's nose cold? Yes, answer that and other fun questions about dogs. Luck with the dice and good memory means that you can paw forward with Anders Bagge on the wonderfully mischievous playing field. A fun and varied game that is filled to the brim with dogs.

Name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Draught of Living Death Promo
Description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Brew a Draft of Living Death:
Costs: 7 Potions and 2 Magic Levels.

You lose 1 Level but you give another player 3 Levels

Name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Locomotion Charm Promo
Description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Craft a Locomotion Charm:
Before placement, move another of your workers to a new location. Gain the reward at that location.

costs 7 Charms - 2 Magic tokens.

Name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Listen to Kreacher's Tale Promo
Description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Hard Challenge:
Listen to Kreacher's Tale
costs 9 Potions - 9 Charms - 3 Knowledge

If the challenge is won, the user wins
70 Gems and 1 Magic token.

Name: Word Colony
Description:
An exciting common knowledge & word game for smart people.

     Choose the correct answer to the general culture questions;
     Collect Letter Cards
     Build Word Colonies using the Letter Cards
     Collect 40, 70 or 100 Points (it depends on the type of game chosen) & Win!


Discover new things about the world around you in an interactive way, with your group of friends or family!

The game can be played by 2 to 4 people, and the playing time varies depending on the type of game chosen (between 30 minutes and 3 hours). Have fun by getting smarter!

—description from the designer

Name: らくがき教科書 (Rakugaki Kyokasho)
Description:
This is two games in one package; ã‚‰ããŒãæ•™ç§‘æ›¸ (Rakugaki Kyokasho) and ã‚ˆã›ãŒãæ•™ç§‘æ›¸ (Yosegaki Kyokasho). Rakugaki means graffiti, Kyokasho is a textbook for children. The second game Yosegaki Kyokasho means Write Jointly Textbook.

The game is from Japan and is home-made. Packaged in a large pencil case, the components include large plastic sleeves with paper inside, wipeable marker pens, and a variety of small cut-outs of portraits and images of various kinds. These might be from famous Western artworks, such as the Mona Lisa or Venus, or famous people such as Beethoven or Napoleon, or animals or objects. Likewise there are popular Japanese characters such as writers, samurai or politicians (including Admiral Perry!), or figures from ukiyo-e scrolls.

The idea of the game is to mimic writing graffiti in your school textbooks. Players put the cut-outs inside the wallets, backed with the white paper. They then use the markers to write their jokes and graffiti on the outside of the wallet, as if writing on the schoolbook. Then players compare their jokes and the funniest is given points. Most points wins.

The designer says "Let's draw a bikini on Sakamoto RyÅma!" (famous samuari and democrat).

The alternate game has players taking turns to choose a theme, such as 'alternate hairstyles', and players draw images to that theme in the same way. This is for players who are not used to making up rude jokes.
user summary

Name: KeyForge Adventures: Rise of the Keyraken
Description:
A preeminent Logos organization, the Society of Logic and Reason, has lost contact with one of its undersea observatories. In anticipation of trouble, they have hired a group of Archons to join the crew of their ship, the SLRS Vortexilon, and investigate. And it’s a good thing, too—the observatory has been destroyed by a beast from ancient mythology, and an Aquan cult is behind it!

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce that cooperative play is coming to KeyForge in two free-to-play adventures that expand upon the themes and mechanics found in Dark Tidings.

These two exciting adventures present players with a new challenge to overcome using the KeyForge decks in their collection. With each adventure playing in a unique way and featuring multiple difficulty levels, you must come up with entirely new strategies to win. Whether you are playing by yourself or with up to two friends, these adventures will take you to the depths of the Crucible’s oceans and face-to-face with epic monsters and cunning cultists.

Name: Erzähl mir was vom Bauernhof
Description: There's always something going on at the farm: cows, horses, pigs, rabbits and chickens run around happily and the tractor chugs across the yard. There is a lot to discover and name, which expands vocabulary and trains perception. The cute figures invite free play and the first rule game. Who finds the right place for his animal?

Name: Goat Yoga Party Game
Description:
In this hilarious party game, players perform real yoga poses while completing ridiculous challenges with an inflatable goat. From balancing the goat on your head to batting it in the air, to bleating the tune to a song...your game night is sure to be filled with positive vibes and laugh-out-loud fun! Show us your moves! Share your pics and tag #GoatYogaPartyGame!

—description from the publisher

Name: Schweizer Trachten-Spiel
Description: The players move by dice over a circuit to collect cards with Swiss costumes cards. The goal is to get sets of 4 cards from as many neighboring cantons as possible to get many extra points. Event cards and fields that lead to card loss are also present. The game ends when all costume cards have been distributed. The player with the most valuable sets wins.

Name: Hyex: In the name of science
Description:
Better keep your hands off this game if you don't want to get your hands dirty! If you are brave enough to involve in this experiment and willing to mercilessly sacrifice your creations in the name of science, you will become the scientist in a laboratory and hybridize and harvest your living samples. Care about your species and slaughter them at the right time to gain more points than your opponent. Be careful to avoid getting the experiment out of control.

Players take turns to spawn and hybridize the samples and harvest them at the right time to gain more victory points which are necessary to win. Each turn chose from following actions and after reaching 12 points game ends.

(at first is increased age of each living sample)


     Draw a sample – draw a card
     Harvest one living sample – gaining points from placed cards and discarding
     Hybridize two samples (attempt with dice rolling) – possibility of placing of 2 cards as one sample, combination of both cards gives the sample unique ability - the most important for gaining victory points
     Spawn one ordinary sample (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – placing one ordinary sample (one card) which provides low amount of points
     Play an alternative action (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – play action shown along left side of the card


—description from the designer

Name: Antiquity of Mars
Description:
Billions of years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. This in turn reduced the planet’s ability to maintain heat. After centuries of research, Mars’ leading scientists have developed a way to slow the depletion of oxygen and the cooling of the planet; however, it’s too little and far too late. It’s only a matter of time before the planet becomes completely uninhabitable. In this harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars dangle from their last thread of existence.

Overview
Each player will represent a leader of one of the remaining races of ancient Mars. They will struggle to maintain the morale of their populace, while helping to keep the planet survivable for as long as possible. Players will also need to maintain control of lands to provide food, water and other resources—a task which may require force. Players will take turns placing multi-use cards on action spaces. The action space chosen will determine which part of the player’s card is activated (political, civil, or military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence to gain more powerful actions, develop technologies to help combat the planet’s condition, gather resources to help keep their populace happy, and train armies to maintain their lands and resources. Each race is equipped with a unique ability allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer

Name: La Cible
Description:
Inspired by a French television show. The game is composed of series of questions of increasing difficulty: "the first round", "the definitions", "the continuation", "the auctions" and "the final".

No answers are provided in the game.

Name: Stargrave: Dead or Alive – Bounty Hunting Solo Scenario Generator
Description:
Stargrave: Dead or Alive, a free supplement that gives you the tools to create and run specific solo adventures for Stargrave: Science Fiction Wargames in the Ravaged Galaxy! With this booklet, your independent crew can travel the galaxy, hunting for
outlaws and criminals with prices on their heads. Your crew might want to see justice done, have a personal score to settle, or maybe they are just in it for the money. Whatever the reason, they will face some tough fights against a rogues’ gallery of unique desperadoes.

Name: TBH: NSFW Expansion
Description:
168 unique adult-themed dilemma cards for use with TBH: The Game of Honest Answers to Outrageous Questions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Recon Rescue
Description:
A special forces recon unit was a on secret mission when their helicopter crashed in the middle of the Vietnam jungle. The unit survived but not the pilot. With the mission scrubbed you have to make to back to the extraction zone and back to safety before the enemy tracks you down and captures you.

Your unit is trying to get to the extraction zone and they are being tracked by the enemy. Each turn your unit and the enemy randomly draw a number of colored d6 in specific order and place them on the player and enemy cards. Depending on the color of the die drawn, will determine any extra bonuses you or the enemy receive. Your squad must defeat the enemies dice to move to the next jungle terrain card. Each move you make can add or delete to your supplies "dice". It is a race to see who can get to the extraction zone first. If the enemy reaches the EZ first, your unit is captured. If the unit reaches the EZ first, you win. Your unit has special abilities that can be used one per game so be careful when using them.

-description from designer

Name: Höllfahren
Description:
The board was used for moving pieces while the players played cards. Depending on where you landed, different rules applied. For example, you had to be quiet or address someone in a specific way. If you failed to follow the rules, you moved a step closer to the centre, where people were being cooked in a pot. If you ended up there, you lost. The last player left was the winner and took all the money.

—user summary

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panzer III J Expansion
Description:
The Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J (lets just call this a Panzer III J for simplicity) looks like the poor cousin of the Panzer IV H but the reality is quite different. With a mobility of 3 and initiative of 8 it is similar to the Cromwell or T-34, but lacks the armour so only has a survivability of 0. Of course this means it is the cheapest ‘fast’ tank you are going to find this side of Prokhorkvka. Looking for more initiative or firepower you can always upgrade the gun to the 3.7cm KW.K 36 L/46.5 or 5cm KW.K 39 L/60 respectively, or add a driver with Preventative Maintenance to let you modify a defensive hit to a critical to keep the tank in the fight a little longer.

Inside the Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M10 Wolverine Expansion
Description:
The M10 Wolverine is your typical tank destroyer, a glass cannon! It packs plenty of punch but if you concentrate your fire you can break it quickly. It has a solid firepower stat, which can be upgraded by replacing the 3” gun that comes as standard with the 76mm AT Gun M1A2 that improves both its firepower and initiative. Pair it up with lower initiative tanks that can shield it from enemy fire and a radio operator with Signal Boosting to improve the initiative of every other tank in your platoon.

Inside the M10 Wolverine Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic M10 Wolverine tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Sherman Firefly Expansion
Description:
This tank acts like a tank destroyer with a massive Firepower 6 stat, but benefits from the medium tank rule that allows it to re-roll a blank attack dice! Use the included Heavy (APCR) Shell ammo upgrade to get even more bang for your buck (or points) or the crew card Concealment to buff your defense if you are planning on lurking in cover.

Inside the Sherman VC Firefly Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic Sherman VC Firefly tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: Angry Birds Go! Jenga: Pirate Pig Attack
Description:
The popular Angry Birds app comes to life in this epic Pirate Pig Attack Game! Can you triumph in this fast-crashing game? Launch your birds to take down the dastardly pirate ship and topple the swashbuckling piggies on their perches! Load your kart and target the pigs just right with your launcher. When you take out the pigs' sailing vessel, you'll become the feather-flying champion of the Pirate Pig Attack Game!

Pirate Pig Attack Game challenges you to take out a Jenga pirate ship with your bird and launcher

Topple the ship for the Angry Birds win

—description from the designer

Name: Quadragon
Description:
Quadragon is a card-driven strategy game in which players build an army of dragons and dragon-riding wizards in order to steal their opponent's treasure and protect their own.

Each card in Quadragon uses both sides of the card, and both sides are split in two, meaning that each card can be used in 4 different ways. One side contains a dragon and treasure, the other a wizard and spell. Dragons are used to attack your opponent's treasure and defend your own. Treasure is used to pay for wizards. Wizards can also steal treasure directly, or ride similarly-colored dragons for even more points. Spells can be cast by wizards to directly manipulate the battlefield, for example rotating or flipping cards, or scoring points. Each side of a card can only be used if the text is facing you, and all cards rotate after use. For example after attacking with a dragon it rotates to reveal its treasure, which makes it vulnerable to attack.

It is always a thrill to chain together a sequence of spells to flip and rotate cards, culminating in a massive points-scoring attack. The first player to reach 50 points wins.

-description from designer

Name: Out Of Shapes
Description: A dice game with shapes instead of numbers. You must collect each shape, but only once, if you roll a shape you have alreay collected, all the dice left, add together for points. As soon as a player reaches 15 points, the player with the lowest score wins.

Name: Trust Me, I'm a Superhero!: Silly Expansion
Description:
You've taken out the trash, and your city is safe again... Or is it? A range of sillier options for family friendly fun is available.

This expansion adds 20 more Powers and 20 more Supers to the game that can be mixed in to add a little silliness and wacky combos to the game.

There are no changes to the rules with this expansion, just mix in, play and laugh yourself silly!

Name: Trust Me, I'm a Superhero: NSFW Expansion
Description:
You've beaten back the baddies, and your city is safe again... Or is it? A range of naughtier options for adult fun is available.

This expansion adds 20 more Powers and 20 more Supers to the game that can be mixed in to add a HUGE... selection of adult combos to the game.

There are no changes to the rules with this expansion, just mix in, play and try not to get yourself too.. worked... up...

Name: Rally Point Volume 18: The French Army – Friend and Foe
Description:
Rally Point Volume 18: The French Army Friend and Foe is a set of 10 all new scenarios featuring the French Army World War II. Each scenario was handmade and play-tested to the high standard players expect from the Tampa ASL Group’s fine craftsmen. Each scenario is presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality card stock.

RPT171 Pentecost Sunday Meeting – West of HANNUT, Belgium, 12 May 1940: Elements of the 12e Cuirassiers, 3e Division Légère Mécanique are conducting a screen with three AMD 35 armored cars and a platoon of sidecar equipped infantry when they are attacked by two platoons of motorcycle infantry from Aufklärungs Abteilung 7 and Pz IB, PzIIA and PZIIF tanks from the Panzer Division 4. This meeting of two reconnaissance units features lots of exciting maneuver for both sides and is an exciting, 5.5 turn tournament action set on boards 11a and 12a.

RPT172 L’embuscade du Geneste – CREHAN, Belgium, 12 May 1940: In this 5.5 turn scenario set on boards 9b, 11a and 85, a company of German infantry supported by nine tanks (including PzIBs, PzIIAs and PzIIIFs) is attacking to clear the village of Crehan when they run into an anti-armor ambush. The French, defending with seven H39 tanks and ten squads make this an action-packed, instant classic.

RPT173 Opportunité Fugace – MONTCORNET, France, 17 May 1940: The French 4 e Bataillon de Chasseurs Portés and 2e Compagnie, 46e Bataillon de Chars de Combat, 4e Division Cuirassée is attacking with seventeen squads, two D2(L) tanks and eight (yes 8) Char B1 bis tanks to the clear some buildings defended by eleven squads of the Pioneer Bataillon 37, Panzer Division 1 and knock out their three FlaK18 88mm guns. With ten tanks on a wide attack frontage, a battery of 88s, a flamethrower and DCs, there will be lots of movement and intense action in this medium sized, 6.5 turn scenario set on boards 11, 12b and 78. It is sure to become a classic.

RPT174 Ejected From Eloi – MONT ST. ELOI, France, 22 May 1940: The 1 ère Division Légère Mécanique is attacking with three S35 tanks and ten squads (including some truckmounted infantry) to clear the village of St Eloi of Battailon 1, Schutzen-Regiment 14, 5th Panzer Division 5’s seven German squads and a 37mm anti-tank gun. This is fast-playing 4.5 turn, tournament action set on boards 19 and 57 was designed by Brook White.

RPT175 Tardiveau Le Volontaire – HERLEVILLE, France, 5 June 1940: A company of German infantry from Infanterie Regiment 104, Infanterie Division 33 is preparing to launch an attack from a board 5 gully against 41e Régiment d’ Infanterie, 19e Division d’ Infanterie defending the board 70 village. Just as the Germans were about to begin their attack, the French launch a preemptive attack of their own with twelve squads and two Lorraine 38L personnel carriers from Detachment Tardiveau. This 5-turn tournament scenario has lots of exciting action.

RPT176 The Weygand Line – ST. FUSCIEN, France, 5 June 1940: Elements of German Infanterie Division 9 and Panzer Division 10 are attacking with eighteen squads to clear the French from town on the board 60 ridge. The 56ème Régiment, 16ème Division d’Infanterie is defending the town with twelve squads, heavily equipped with machine guns and supported by 80mm off-board artillery. This 6.5 turn, medium-sized, all infantry action also uses boards 9b and 11b.

RPT177 Tirailleurs and Antiques - MANICAMP, France, 5 June 1940: A German infantry company of fifteen squads from Infanterie Regiment 124, Infanterie Division 72 is attacking to clear the French from the wooden buildings of board 71’s village. Here, nine squads of the 18e Régiment Tirailleurs Algériens, 87e Division d’ Infanterie Afrique are defending with the help of three World War One vintage FT-17 tanks from 36e Bataillon de Chars de Combat. This 5.5 turn scenario was designed by Evan Sherry and also uses board 72.

RPT178 The Joffre Line – South of ANTSIRANE, Madagascar, 6 May 1942: The British 1 st Battalion Royal Scots Fusiliers, 2nd Battalion East Lancashire Regiment and 455 Light Battery (with seventeen squads, 94mm guns, carriers and Valentine/Tetrarch tanks) are attacking in three groups to seize control of buildings from the Vichy French 1st Battalion (Senegalese) and 2 nd Battalion (Malagache), 2nd Regiment, Fortress Diego Suarez’s eleven squads and four 75mm artillery pieces that are defending from trenches and a pillbox on boards x, 69 and 78. Can they hold out long enough for their World War I vintage FT17 tanks to save the day? Mike Augustine designed this large, but fast-playing 5 turn scenario.

RPT179 Operation Terminal – PORT OF ALGIERS, ALGERIA, 8 November 1942: The American 3rd Battalion, 135th Infantry Regiment, 34th Infantry Division with twelve squads have gone on the defensive in the face of a spirited Vichy French counter-attack by elements of 13ème Régiment de Tirailleurs Sénégalais with fourteen squads and six (yes 6) FT17 tanks. Mike Augustine designed this medium-sized, 5 turn scenario that uses boards 20, 23 and 49.

RPT180 Rapidement Vaincu – DOMPAIRE, France, 13 September 1944: Elements of the Free French 2 ème Division Blindée are attacking with four Sherman tanks, an M-10 tank destroyer and both dismounted and halftrack-mounted infantry to clear elements of Panzergrenadier Regiment 2112 and Panzer Abteilung 2112, Panzer Brigade 112 (with inexperienced tank crews) from their defensive positions in the town on boards 68 and 71. This is a 5.5 turn, medium sized scenario that has lots of movement for both sides and portrays one of the Free French Army’s greatest victories in the ETO.

Name: Quad Play: [4]Deck
Description:
A non-traditional playing card deck based on The Quad Play game system.

Includes 40 cards. No fixed suits. Card are arranged in two dimensions and divided in two sides, so that suits can be set dynamically. Cards have positive, negative or zero value. The deck balance is 0.

The basic game ("Draw" or "Dr[4]w") rules:
Each card (quad) has 4 pieces (qarts) in one colour (dark or light). These ones define the quad's cost in pts. Dark (purple) qarts have non-negative costs and vice-versa. Center purple qart gives 4 pts as all four hearts intersect each other here. Triangular qart so gives 2 pts and outer one (leaf) means 0. For example, The Good Sign (a quad with 4 purple qarts in shape of full heart) costs 8 pts in total. Players (2 by default) pick 4 quads in a turn. The summary quads' cost in each hand multiplies by 10 (multiplier from 4 to 40). Other number quads to pick is possible (with an appropriate multiplier). The number of turns is conventional (1 by default). The leader in pts wins.
Actually, many traditional card games can also be played with the Quad Deck. The new game logic brings a new experience into a regular game-play.

[4] The Good Sign is first of all... [4]

—user summary

Name: På tur i Villmarka med Lars Monsen
Description:
Conquer the Norwegian wilderness with wilderness expert Lars Monsen. Walk, ski, kayak, bike or use dog sled from region to region. Read the map and plan your journey to ensure you outrace your competitors.

Each player is given four cards representing different types of transportation. From each location, only a few transportation options are available, so the players must plan their journey to fit their available transporation cards. After each turn, they draw cards to replace the cards they spent, so that they always start with a hand of four cards.

There are three types of locations on the map: Destinations, where you stop to pick up a location tag for your backpack. Events, where you stop to get wilderness advise from the expert - depending on which option you choose, you can get ahead, fall behind, or help or hinder your opponent. And finally, Minor locations, where you can just pass through without stopping.

To win, you have to be the first player to get a location tag from all five regions, and collect three event cards with a different animal on the back.

Name: EXIT Challenge: Berlin Underground
Description:
Deep underneath Berlin there is a secret hacker group Berlin Underground. They fight fraud on the internet. You would like to join but nobody knows how to get in touch with them. One day you find yourselves in a locked prison cell. Is this going to be a test by Berlin Underground?

—description from the box (translated)

Name: 80': the Eightieth Minute
Description:
A solo soccer storytelling game.

Experience the last minutes of the last match of a grueling soccer campaign, the glory or the heartbreak of an all-or-nothing result.  Ten minutes plus stoppage time remain.  All still to play for.

It is the 80th minute . . .

To play you will need:

     10 to 20 minutes
     two 6-sided dice
     a standard 52 card deck
     a 20-sided die (or pen and paper)
     some way to narrate the events as they unfold on the pitch


Flip a card representing a minute of time and roll to see if your team has the grit to weather the late pressure, if the referee is going to add more time.

Narrate the play on the field (for a radio, blog, or newspaper audience) based on prompts tied to each card.

If the last card is discarded before a goal is conceded, your team wins the title (or avoids relegation, or qualifies for the World Cup)!

—description from the designer

Name: Logistix
Description:
Logistix is about combining logistics and logic. In a large container terminal, as the leader of a forklift crew, you have to make sure that the right containers get onto your ship. Each ship must be loaded according to a certain loading plan and following certain rules, so that the unloading of the cargo at the destination port runs efficiently. As if that wasn't enough, the shipping company has given you special assignments for loading. The player who manages, with skill and a good portion of brainpower, to get into position for the right containers, load them onto the ship according to the rules and fulfil the shipping company's orders, collects the most points and wins the game.

In each round of Logistix you will go through two phases. In the first, each of you bids on the slots that contain your desired containers. You will have to use a lot of skill, maybe even bluffing, to get the right containers. Once you've got the containers, you'll have to solve the loading puzzle on your ship, keeping in mind the shipping company's assignments.

—description from the designer

Name: 2020: The Board Game
Description:
A game designed for those that wish to leave 2020 behind! Create your circle of friends to help you survive the financial hardships of 2020. Do whatever it takes to survive this year above the rest but remember: Problematic players lose their jobs, sponsorships, friends and sometimes even money.

In 2020: The Board Game, players will use their turns to acquire friends, earn income, and avoid the harrowing pitfalls of the real-life disaster that was the year 2020. On each turn, the player will roll the dice, and move their piece the corresponding number of spaces. They then draw and resolve a Social Media card that will present them with a unique real world event that happened in 2020. After drawing the card, players then must resolve the space they've landed on, which may mean acquiring a new friend to help you through the game, or gaining money and/or paying off debt they've accrued.

Players gain survival points based on the cards that they play, and when a player has acquired ten survival points, the end of the game is triggered. At the end of that round, players count their money and the player with the most money wins.

2020: The Board Game provides players with a chance to look back and laugh at the monstrosity of 2020.

—description from the designer

Name: Robotech Macross Dog Fight: The Miniatures Game
Description:
A gigantic spaceship crash lands on Earth, foreshadowing the arrival of an alien armada bent on war and destruction. The world unites to unlock the secrets of its miraculous alien technology known as Robotech to defend the world against impending invasion. The challenges they would face would be greater than anyone could have imagined...

Tailor a combination of talented pilots and powerful mechs. Outmanoeuvre your opponents and finish them with the right weapons. Survive until the end and claim your victory.

The game plays over multiple rounds. Each round consists of four phases in order. 

     Planning - Plan your movement secretly. 
     Movement - Move according to the plan
     Cross Event - Initiate a quick battle when mechs cross paths. 
     Combat - Shoot your opponent down! 


The game ends when only one player or one team has mechs remaining in the battlefield. The survivor is declared the winner. If the last mechs of each player is eliminated in the same phase, the player with lower total pilot and mech costs wins. If the totals are equal, the game ends in a tie.

Name: Family Frakass
Description:
Familiy Frakass is a Beat them up board game.
It’s a 1 to 3 players cooperative boardgame based on the main characteristic than Beat them up game: Hit, Strike, Weapons, Combo, Henchmen, Boss...
The objective is quite simple, clean the board of each scene of the stage to reach the Boss. Beat it and continue on the next stage.

Each player will have a character with their own  specificities.
Then the game will switch between 2 phases: The Player turn and the Game turn.
During the Player turn, the player will use up to 3 action points to make his character moves, strikes or one of the 10 actions available for him.
The only main rules to follow there is: “A player cannot do the same action twice in the row during his turn.” (Means, you can Move, Strike and Move, but you cannot Move, Move, and Strike.)
Then when players finish their turn, the Game turn will start and the game will move by itself following 5 main actions. Those actions are also link to the action
Then it will be to the player turn again.

Regarding the Strike part, player will use colors cards common to all players. Each Heroes character have his own combos. A combo is a specific combination of colors. Means you will have to choose between use your cards of save it to prepare the combo.
You can now add Weapons, Group combo, Character posture and lots of mechanism for more fun and strike! (^_^)

If I try to explains this game by “mechanism”, I would say that an Action evolutive Puzzle, because the situation will change at every Game turn depending of the action done by player(s).

—description from the designer

Name: Math Batt: Mathematical Battle
Description:
Math-Batt (Mathematical Battle) is a card game that teaches times tables to children in an explosion of excitement, bold colours, and adorable cartoon characters. Get the numbers on your side and win the war of multiplication! The fun starts with two or more players. The deck contains 90 cards, divided evenly. On each card you'll find one multiplication equation. To "battle" each player reveals the top card of their stack. The player with the highest equation result wins. For instance, 2 x 2 = 4 defeats 2 x 1 = 2. The winner takes all the cards played in the round. Sometimes battles result in a "draw" where players end up with the same number. When this happens the two must duel in a "war". Players take two cards from their hand, placing one face down and the next face up. Whoever has the higher face-up card wins the war, and takes the other players' pair of cards. Players who run out of cards during the war immediately lose. The game continues until only one player emerges victorious with all 90 cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Winter War 1939: A Solo Game
Description:
Winter War 1939: A Solo Game

A solo game where you command a platoon of Finnish infantry trying to stop waves of Russian attackers.
The Russians will still keep on coming until they eventually win.
The object of the game is to see how many waves of attackers you stop.

A simple to play game with lots of variety to keep the game different each time you play.

Turn Sequence:
1- Activate Russian troops
2- Activate Finnish troops
3- Roll for random events

—description from the publisher

Name: Disney/Pixar Toy Story: Talent Show
Description: Step right up and show off your talents in a friendly competition of card play and challenges! You’ll be balancing, tossing, roping, and rolling your way to winning the most Prize Tickets! Players collect Prize Tickets for performing Talents and playing out their cards.  At the end of the game, the player with the most points on their Prize Tickets wins!

Name: Disney/Pixar: You Can Fly!
Description: Choose one of four Disney character flyers — Dumbo, Buzz Lightyear, Pegasus, or Tinker Bell. Then soar through the sky, among the stars, to infinity and beyond in this imagination-fueled adventure! Create your own course through the house or outdoors and face funny flying challenges — throw with your eyes closed, between your legs, and more! Land your flyer the closest to the clouds and collect the most points to win!

Name: Disney: Hidden Mickeys
Description:
The out-of-your-seat game with two ways to find Mickey! Play hide and seek with the colorful Mickey Markers, plus look for Hidden Mickeys on the cards! Two clever activities in one fun-filled game! On your turn, flip over a card from the pile. If you flip a Mickey card, one player hurries to find the matching

Hidden Mickey Marker in the house or yard! Bring it back in time to score a card! Once all the Mickey Markers have been found, search for Hidden Mickeys on your reward cards! Find the most Mickeys to win!

Name: Delenda Roma
Description:
It's the end of the Roman Empire: barbarians at the gates, rebels inside the empire, fighting in the senate.
Will you be able to avoid fate, or will Rome be destroyed?

Delenda Roma is a single player board game when you try to stop the inevitability of the history.

At the start of the game player get a limited amount of gold and armies to be placed on roman provinces, then gameplay is divided in phases:


     Event phase: from a deck of cards a new challenge is revealed ( like for example new barbarian invading from outside of the empire or a rebellion on the roman provinces).
     Battle phase: for provinces with enemy armies a deterministic fight occurs
     Upkeep phase: determine for provinces who is in control and apply consequences
     Enemy phase: every enemy units move according to their type
     Player phase: player can spend gold to move armies (by land and sea), recruit new armies, placate rebels or bribe the senate
     Senate phase: from another deck of cards a senate card is revealed and player has limited turns to fulfil the mission


Player lose when barbarian or rebels take control of Roma and win if they can survive at least 20 turns.

—description from the designer

Name: Das Zehnkampfspiel
Description:
The players roll a die and move around the game board while competing in the 10 decathlon disciplines. They may accept the result of the space they land on or choose to roll again to achive a better result, thereby risking a fail by overshooting the last space of this discipline. If this is the case they have to complete this discipline in another trip around the board. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

When the first player completes all 10 disciplines the game ends and the player who scored the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Die Posträuber
Description:
The players, as the police, try to catch the main train robber, which is secretly determined by the robber-players and find the bag of loot by moving policemen around the game map and collecting hints. Movement is determined by a die.

The players form two teams: the police and the robbers. Any player may move any figure of hie own team. The robber team decides in secret which robber is the main culprit and which bag contains the loot. From this information they create a secret password from the main feature of the main culprit and the letter of the bag with the loot, for example Moon Boot (Monocle + B 001). The card with the number of the loot bag is removed from the stack and the stach is placed front down on it's space on the game board. The robbers and the bags (front down) are placed on the railway bridge and the police officers at police headquarters.

The robbers try to reach a hideaway (circular blue spaces), which can't be entered by a policeman. If a robber reaches a hideaway the player takes a bag from the bridge and places it inside the hideaway. The police have half an hour to find the main culprit and the bag with the loot. They try to reach the railway bridge while there are still some robbers and bags.

If a policeman gets to the railway bridge, he may turn over all the bags still there and takes all robbers still at at bridge to the prison to interrogate them.

If a figure gets on an orange space, the player takes the upper card from the stack and follows the instructions printed there, depending if he is a policeman or a robber. Some cards contain information for the police about empty bags.

The policemen take robbers into prison to interrogate them, if they land on a space occupied by a robber. During the first interrogation the robber has to tell the password. In further interrogations the police asks about the features of the main culprit (main feature, clothes, tie, ...). The robber has to answer truthfully wit "yes" or "no". Additionally the policeman may turn over any bag and ask, if this bag contains the loot.

The police wins, if they discover who is the main culprit and which bag contains the money inside half an hour. If not, the robbers win. The robbers win also if all get into hideaways, where they are safe from the police.

Name: Fishing Boats (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
Description:
The rivers around Carcassonne provide a bounty of fish. Although some of the anglers prefer to fish
from the shores of the rivers, there are others who will take a small boat out to the middle of the
river to fish. Fishing boats can be used like Wagons for the roads.

Name: Die Schotterbande
Description:
Die Schotterbande, a co-operative board game for children from 6 to 10, teaches the handling of money in a playful and realistic way, and this is the story behind the game:

A group of friends overhears a secret conversation. Villains want to steal all the money in town! The children want to prevent this at all costs. In just 10 days, they must become superheroes to protect the city's money bunker.

Name: Trans-Europe
Description:
The game is played on a stylized map of Europe with a printed transport network. Players are given a starting location, a destination, and 4 transportation orders to 4 European cities. Players set a driving route and move their pieces across the transportation network. The movement is controlled by a turntable. Depending on the freight, one of the 8 possible directions and speeds of travel can be selected 4 times truck (slow), 2 times freight train (medium) or 2 times freight express train (fast). 
In his turn, the player rolls the dice once and must either draw and execute an event card or turn the turntable to the left or right and move his figure accordingly. Cities with transport orders and the destination city must be reached exactly.
The player who arrives first at his destination city wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Post of Honour: Wargames rules for the War of the Austrian Succession & the Seven Years' War 1740-1763
Description:
Post of Honour – Wargames rules for the War of the Austrian Succession & the Seven Years War 1740-1763 is designed for a ‘classic’ historical wargame.

Features:

     12-20 units per side, 
     game lasts a couple of hours,
     it can be played at home or at your wargaming club. 
     the overall commander controls 3 to 5 brigades and up to 2 independent units.


The rules were developed for games using 25-30mm figures, and conversion to other scales is easy.

Turn Sequence
Each turn has 5 phases:
1- Initiative. The winner elects to be side A or side B.
2- Movement. Side A moves (generals move last), then side B moves (generals last).
3- Firing. Simultaneous fighting.
4- Close Combat. Simultaneous fighting. Initiative winner chooses order of combats.
5- Generalship & Rallying. Simultaneous. Generalship first, then rally checks.
Morale may need to be checked in the movement, firing, or close combat phases.

—description from the rulebook
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Enchanters: Deluxe Box
Description:
Enchanters is all about saving a village from monsters. Shuffle a few Kingdom decks together to create the set of items, enchantments and threats! On your turn, journey to collect a card from these decks, or rest to recover. Stack up equipment and enchantments to become the best battlemage!

In the fantasy card-drafting game Enchanters, you create an artifact and upgrade it each turn. Every card you take retains some of its power. As you grow stronger, you can take on more powerful monsters and, if you plan well, even defeat a dragon.

To set up the game, each player takes five crystals, then you shuffle together as many kingdom decks as the number of players, then lay out six cards (either items of enchantments) on the journey track. In the game, players take turns to embark on quests, collecting cards from the journey track by paying with crystals. Acquired cards are placed into adjacent stacks, with something like “Long Sword” going into the item stack and cards like “of Fire” going into the enchantment stack; combined, these cards create the “Long Sword of Fire”, and cards grant both temporary bonuses (upper icons and skills) and permanent ones (bottom icons).

Included in the Deluxe Box :

Overlords decks: Bandits, Cultists, Unicorns, Gnolls, Goblins, Draco, Barbarians, Faires, Angels, Troglodytes , Undead, Dark Elves, Golems, Mages, Slimes and Demons

Odyssey decks: Centaurs, Gladiators, Harpies, Medusae, Mermaids and Mummies

East Quest: decks Ninjas, Monks, Samurais, Nagas, Pirates and Geishas

Event Deck
    Class Deck
    Banner Deck
    Coop Deck
    Mythic Deck
    Wound Deck (eshop exclusive)
    Quest Deck
    all Villages
    all Overlords
    Banners and classes
    Crystal set
    Plastic Wound tokens
    Shuriken Tokens
    Pearl Tokens
    Defence and attack plastic tracker tokens
    Fate cards for Solo play
    Neoprene kit

Name: Merchants Cove: Backer-built Rogue Pack
Description:
Originally included in the Kickstarter campaign, these additional Rogue cards were created from backer comments. They haven't been fully playtested and balanced though.

Included are 3 blank cards and 5 new Rogue cards:


    Genies
            May be placed on Boats during setup.
            4 in the Adventurer bag & 4 in the Lair
            Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, you may move 1 small Good matching a Customer on that Boat from your supply to your Sale Shelf. If you choose not to, all other players draw 1 Corruption card, starting in clockwise order.
        
    



    Vigilantes
            May be placed on Boats during setup.
            2 in the Adventurer bag & 6 in the Lair
            Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, remove 1 Rogue from the Lair and place it into the Adventurer bag.
        
    



    Revolutionaries
            May be placed on Boats during setup.
            6 in the Adventurer bag & 0 in the Lair
            Effect: During Final Scoring, Corruption is worth positive Gold instead of negative, and Faction Icons are worth negative Gold instead of positive.
        
    



    Superbackers
            May be placed on Boats during setup.
            4 in the Adventurer bag & 3 in the Lair
            Effect: Increase the base Gold price of all Goods sold at a Dock containing a Rogue by 1. If there are multiple Rogues here, the price increases by 1 for each one present.
        
    



    Automatons
            May be placed on Boats during setup.
            5 in the Adventurer bag & 3 in the Lair
            Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, each player may optionally draw 1 Corruption card to activate any 1 Staff Ability on their Staff board per Rogue on the Boat. If a Boat that Docks contains multiple Rogues, each Staff Ability may be activated once at most, for a total cost of 1 Corruption. These chosen Staff Abilities do not require a hired townsfolk.

Name: Toerkk
Description:
Toerkk is a fast paced fantasy card game with innovative mechanics for 2 to 4 players.
