Play as one of the dwarven warlords and win the game either by digging out 20 levels of ground to find a mythical torc buried deep down in the heart of the mountain or simply by eliminating your opponents by reducing their health points to 0 using your warriors, abilities and spells. But beware, land of Bokvyst is a mysterious place, every turn you will have to face the powers which rule this area. You have to plan your strategy on the go as the situation in the playground changes with every swing of a hammer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rogue Trooper: Lone Trooper
Description: Official solitaire rules for Rogue Trooper from White Dwarf magazine, issue 93.

Name: PickUp
Description:
PickUp is a fast-paced basketball deck-building card game that will wow you with it's authentic basketball gameplay and 40+ visually stunning characters!

The game puts you in the roles of GM, coach, and player, interweaving chance and strategy.

In an exciting head-to-head showdown, each team starts with the same roster of players. Teams can then use their players on the court or trade them for better, more specialized players to build out their roster.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Road to War: 1898-1914
Description:
Did you ever dream being the Empress of an Empire on which the sun never sets and who rules the seas; 
or to get the rightful place in the sun for your nation, spreading your Kultur and influence, challenging Britania’s mastery of the oceans and deterring jealous rivals with an army nobody can match alone; 
or to free your Slavic brethens from oppression, getting access to the warm seas and dominating Asia; 
or to fulfill your ‘Mission Civilisatrice’ and perhaps even recover your lost provinces? 

This game is for you!

An historical boardgame for 4 players

Card driven, with events and card points, you take the head of one of the most formidable powers of the era, from 1898 to a possible Great War. 
You will garner victory, prestige, strength and influence by making alliances, destroying adverse ones, controlling up to 11 other secondary powers, placing troops and colonies to expand your empire and hinder rival ones, fomenting strikes and colonial uprisings, leading the naval and armament races, all this under the threat of a looming world war. 
Fashoda, US-Spanish war, Russo-Japanese war, the Boers, the Great Game, German Naval league and Sarajevo are now all yours to confront and overcome…

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Club Brugge
Description:
The largest club in the country celebrates its 130th anniversary and can be discovered shortly via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every centimetre, exciting matches that go back and forth, the insane goal that falls from the sky or the repulsive comeback: experience the most beautiful moments of Club Brugge with family and friends!

Club Brugge is and remains the biggest football club in the country. This has not changed in recent years, quite the contrary. 
Dribble through Club icons from past and present. 
Discover the best Club players, create your own ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Club Brugge is the ideal way to relive the blue-black's finest moments.

Bluvn Goan - We Are Bruges

The Limited Fan Edition has a stylish hand numbered sleeve. Only 1891 pieces of this edition are available.

–description from the publisher

Name: Guilds of Bitalus
Description:
Welcome to the Guilds of Bitalus, a 1-4 player action selection game in which you’ll take command of a band of adventurers, seeking to earn fame, respect, and reputation from the burgeoning merchant city of Bitalus. You’ll do this by taking on contracts, going on expeditions, fighting in the colosseum, and doing business in the city markets.  At the end of the game, the player with the most reputation points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Art Gallery
Description:
In this game, each player assumes the role of an artist in the disputed world of galleries. Each player has one special skill from the character and must use them wisely throughout the game.

Each turn, one of the players will be the Maecenas and make a request. Each artist must choose one card in hand that best fits the Maecenas demand, the closer you get to it, the more points you get.

For the production of Art Gallery, the game designer Igor Colares invited dozens of people, among them children, adults, professional illustrators and amateurs. For each one, Igor asked for an art and said a feeling and an element. The artists then created based on that request. What we have as a result is an incredible variation of styles and a fun walk through the subjectivity of each person.

—description from the designer
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Monasterium: Market Stall
Description: The monks have opened a market stall on the path. Every time you visit or pass it, you will get a specialty from the monasteries, that brings you advantages. With this small expansion "Monasterium" becomes even more exciting and varied.

Name: Monopoly: Leuven
Description:
The student city is for sale! 
Leuven, city with historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Leuven is the ideal way to (re) discover Leuven in a different way. 
Visit St. Peter's Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Arenberg Castle, organize a performance in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in Bondgenotenlaan or treat your friends to a café on the Oude Markt. 
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Louvain has to offer.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand-numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Monopoly: Belgian Red Devils
Description:
Discover the most famous national football team in the world now via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every inch, captivating matches, the last minute goal for which everyone is holding their breath: experience the most exciting Red Devils moments with your family and friends!

This generation of Devils is the strongest our country has known. Both of them have experience in the best European competitions. Dribble through the national team and discover the best Belgian footballers. Lukaku, De Bruyne, Hazard, Witsel, Vertonghen, Courtois, ... put together your ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Belgian Red Devils is the perfect way to relive the best moments of this golden generation. See you at the final?

This game is bilingual NL-FR. With the English version we add maps and rules in English.

The limited edition gold comes with a hand-numbered gold leaf outer box and certificate. From this box, 1895 pieces are available.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: マーブル (MABR)
Description:
ãƒžãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ« (MABR) is a word game from Japan. The 70 card deck has English letters on one side, and corresponding Hiragana on the other. With all the hiragana (including the dakuon and semi-voiced sounds) and the first letter of the romanised form (a for a, k for ki) written on both sides.

There are three different ways to play with the cards.

1) ã‚¬ã‚µã‚´ã‚½ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆ Rustle Alphabet
Players put the cards spread out on the table, with the side with the roman alphabet facing up. Players choose a theme and have a limited amount of time to collect cards to make up words in Japanese that are associated with the theme. Players take up cards to make a word, seeing the Hiragana side.

For example, if the theme is 'summer', then players could make japanese words like ã™ã„ã‹ (watermelon), ã²ã¾ã‚ã‚Š (sunflower), ã¼ã‚“ãŠã©ã‚Š (bon odori), ã†ã¡ã‚ (uchiwa) and so on. But players can only see the roman letters on the table and there is only one card for each Hiragana. So if a player uses the R card for the Hiragana ã‚Š (ri) in sunflower, then another player will not be able to complete 'bon odori'.

2) ã‚¹ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ¬ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚º Three Letters
The deck is shuffled and players are dealt three hand cards. Players hold their cards with the roman alphabet facing out to the other players.

In turn, players draw one card from the deck, and discard one card from their hand. A player is trying to get to a Japanese word using the Hiragana that they see. Once they have a word, they declare, and other players have 20 seconds to guess the word they've made from seeing the roman letters.

For example, if the player is showing KNK as their three cards, is their word ãã®ã“ (mushroom), or ãã‚“ã“ (Kinko), or ã“ã‚“ã (Konki)?

3) ã‚‚ã‚„ã‚‚ã‚„ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚º Misty Memories
This is a team game played in 2 v 2 or 3 v 3.

Players are at a reunion, having a nice conversation. However, it's been a long time, and memories are hazy. Try to get through it with a reasonable answer!

Players use the cards they have been dealt to compose word using all the vowel sounds, AEIOU. The theme is decided by the letters on top of the deck, such as N → "The moment I wanted to cry". Then one team asks the other team to tell a story, using the roman letters to make a word key to the story. For example "Tell us about that time when you really wanted to cry. It was about... TKS!" The challenged team has to reach into their memories, and recount a story using a Japanese word formed from TKS and vowels. If they can make up a good story, they get awarded points.
user summary

Name: Monopoly: Hasselt
Description:
Hasselt has it: its own Monopoly!

Hasselt, provincial capital, trendsetter and ideal base for the province: Limburg begins here.

Historical sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere. 
Monopoly Hasselt is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way. 
Walk through the rich history and culture of the city, but make sure you don't end up in jail!

Visit the cathedral, build a hotel in the TT district, take a stroll in the Japanese Garden, go to the Jeneverfeesten or run a stall at Pukkelpop! Hasselt is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace one another.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beautiful things Hasselt has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Hasseller, or Hasselt lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

–description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Ieper
Description:
Ypres, City of Cats, City of Peace and Pearl of the Westhoek.

Historic sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere. 
Monopoly Ypres is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way. 
Stroll through the rich history and culture of the city but beware of ending up in prison!

Visit the cathedral on the Vandenpeereboomplein, buy a hotel on the Vismarkt, take a stroll on the Fortifications, go to the Ypres Rally or join the Kattenstoet! 
Ypres is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace each other.

This Monopoly-edition takes you to all the beauty that Ypres has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Ypres-lover.

–description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Sint-Niklaas
Description:
The capital of Waasland is for sale! Sint-Niklaas, city of historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Sint-Niklaas is the ideal way to (re)discover Sint-Niklaas in a different way. 
Visit the Sint-Nicolas Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Witte Molen, organise a show in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in the Stationsstraat or take a stroll in the De Ster recreation area. 
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Sint-Niklaas has to offer.

This unique publication is a must-have for every Sint-Niklaas citizen or Sint-Niklaas-lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 91 copies of this edition will be made. The box will have a unique, stylish hand numbered sleeve.

–description from the publisher
